titlestmt.titleproper: Register of Center for Entrepreneurship records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jennifer Kim

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-06-14T15:18-0600

origination.corpname: Brigham Young University. Center for Entrepreneurship

appraisal.p: Part of University Archives; college records (University Archives collecting policy February 2010).

accessrestrict.p: Restricted. Closed for 25 years after the creation of the records and thereafter open to the public after consultation with the University Archivist and in accordance with the General Restriction Statement of the L. Tom Perry Special Collections.

userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the researcher to obtain any necessary copyright clearances. Permission to publish material from Center for Entrepreneurship records must be obtained from the Supervisor of Reference Services and/or the L. Tom Perry Special Collections Board of Curators.

prefercite.p: Initial citation: UA 1316; Center for Entrepreneurship records; University Archives; L. Tom Perry Special Collections, Harold B. Lee Library, Brigham Young University. Following citations: UA 1316, LTPSC.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials from the Center for Entrepreneurship during the years 1985-2002. Class handouts and outlines, internship scholarship applications of students, meeting minutes and agendas, correspondence, and videotapes of lectures can be found in this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Center for Entrepreneurship is a center located within the Marriott School of Management. It is supported by founders, who are practicing entrepreneurs who support the entrepreneurship curriculum and program at Brigham Young University. Currently, there are 140 founders. The Center for Entrepreneurship is all about helping BYU students turn their entrepreneurial ideas to fruition. The Center provides helpful resources for developing your own business ideas and learning to think creatively and competitively. It also provides a mentoring program where successful entrepreneur members of the BYU community volunteer their time and talents to help BYU students develop their business ideas.
